snippet: Chris McDaniel sees David Brat’s unlikely primary defeat of House Leader Eric Cantor as a springboard to victory over longtime incumbent Thad Cochran.
abstract: Defeat of Rep Eric Cantor in Virginia primary is energizing backers of Mississippi State Sen Chris McDaniel, Tea Party-backed candidate who has upended state's Republican order by forcing Sen Thad Cochran into a runoff; conservative groups are intensifying their activity in Mississippi, where McDaniel has done well with connecting to voters among whom suspicion of Washington runs deep.

byline.original: By NICK CORASANITI and SHERYL GAY STOLBERG
byline.contributor: Nick Corasaniti reported from Ellisville, and Sheryl Gay Stolberg from Washington. Jonathan Weisman contributed reporting from Washington, and Daniel Brunty from Starkville, Miss.

lead_paragraph: Chris McDaniel sees David Brat’s unlikely primary defeat of House Leader Eric Cantor as a springboard to victory over longtime incumbent Thad Cochran.

headline.seo: Chris McDaniel Works to Topple Thad Cochran
headline.main: Upset Fueling Tea Party Hope in Senate Race
headline.print_headline: Upset Fueling Tea Party Hope in Senate Race
